column4: is there any command or program that'll rerun whateverUbuntu runs during a clean install to detect the monitor settings?
firestarter or snort. the former is simple and straight forward, the latter may take some reading
firestarter or snort to change monitor display?  n/m, your note I guess was meant for checkmate.
for one it uses "dash" as default system shell, aside from user shell which is still bash.
